meanings.definition: To cut or trim with a sharp tool or instrument.
meanings.sent1: I will strim the bushes in the garden with my shears.
meanings.sent2: She likes to strim her hair to keep it neat and tidy.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally strimmed off more hair than intended!
meanings.sent4: The chef expertly strimmed the vegetables into perfect shapes.
meanings.sent5: The tailor carefully strimmed the fabric to create a beautiful dress.

meanings.sent1: The strim of the scissors could be heard as she cut the paper.
meanings.sent2: He performed a quick strim of the hedge to make it look neat.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful strim of the curtains left them in a mess.
meanings.sent4: The swift strim of the knife through the cake was satisfying to watch.
meanings.sent5: The barber's precise strim of the hair made the customer look fresh.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for cutting or trimming.
meanings.sent1: She used the strim to trim the edges of the lawn.
meanings.sent2: The gardener's favorite strim broke while cutting the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The new strim gadget made trimming the hedges much easier.
meanings.sent4: The old strim had sentimental value as it was passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: The sharp blades of the strim made cutting through the branches effortless.
